output.conclusion: This course provided a comprehensive overview of statistical analysis, equipping you with the skills to analyze data and draw meaningful conclusions. Next steps include practicing with real-world datasets and exploring advanced statistical techniques.
output.introduction: Welcome to Statistical Analysis! This course is designed for learners with some prior knowledge of statistics. We will delve deeper into various statistical methods, focusing on practical applications and interpretation of results.

chapters.description: Review of null and alternative hypotheses, type I and type II errors, power of a test, and p-values. Focus on selecting the appropriate test based on data type and research question.
Learn how to perform a one-sample t-test, including assumptions, calculation of the t-statistic, and interpretation of results. Examples with varying sample sizes.
Learn how to perform a two-sample t-test, including assumptions, calculation of the t-statistic, and interpretation of results. Examples with varying sample sizes.
Introduction to Analysis of Variance (ANOVA). Understanding the underlying assumptions of ANOVA, including normality, homogeneity of variance, and independence.
Performing one-way ANOVA to compare means of multiple groups. Calculating F-statistic, degrees of freedom, and interpreting ANOVA results. Post-hoc tests for pairwise comparisons.
Performing two-way ANOVA to compare means of multiple groups. Calculating F-statistic, degrees of freedom, and interpreting ANOVA results. Post-hoc tests for pairwise comparisons.

Exploring different types of correlation coefficients (Pearson, Spearman, Kendall). Interpreting correlation coefficients and understanding their limitations. Scatter plots and visual assessment of relationships.
Building and interpreting simple linear regression models. Understanding the assumptions of linear regression. Evaluating model fit using R-squared and residual analysis.
Building and interpreting multiple linear regression models. Understanding the assumptions of linear regression. Evaluating model fit using R-squared and residual analysis.
